bill_title: prohibit the recovery of noneconomic loss for persons not having proof of financial responsibility at the time of a motor vehicle accident.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to prohibit the recovery of noneconomic loss for persons not having proof of financial responsibility at the time of a motor vehicle accident. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. In any action against a secured person to recover damages because of accidental bodily injury arising out of the ownership or operation of a motor vehicle in this state, no secured person may be assessed damages for noneconomic loss for a bodily injury in favor of a person who was operating a motor vehicle owned by that person at the time of injury without valid proof of financial responsibility in order to respond to damages for liability arising out of the ownership, maintenance, or use of that vehicle. Section 2. For the purposes of this Act, the term, secured person, means the owner, operator, or occupant of a motor vehicle, and any other person legally responsible for the acts or omissions of the owner, operator, or occupant. 300 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.029 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
